name: relbrcnv
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wb(wbr(c0, ccnv(c1), c2), wbr(c2, c1, c0))

stmt.origin: ax-mp(wb(wbr(c0, ccnv(c1), c2), wbr(c2, c1, c0)), wrel(c1))

body.origin:
|- wb(wbr(c0, ccnv(c1), c2), wbr(c2, c1, c0))
-| wrel(c1)
-| wi(wrel(c1), wb(wbr(c0, ccnv(c1), c2), wbr(c2, c1, c0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wbr(c0, ccnv(c1), c2), wbr(c2, c1, c0))
-| wrel(c1)
-| wi(wrel(c1), wb(wbr(c0, ccnv(c1), c2), wbr(c2, c1, c0)))

body.origin: |- wi(wrel(c1), wb(wbr(c0, ccnv(c1), c2), wbr(c2, c1, c0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wbr(c0, ccnv(c1), c2), wbr(c2, c1, c0))
-| wrel(c1)

comment: When ` R ` is a relation, the sethood assumptions on ~ brcnv can be omitted. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)
